medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Subject 1 (AR) presented at 15 years with recurrent infections and mucocutaneous candidiasis; Subject 2 (DR) presented at 7 years with hypocalcemia and prolonged Q-T interval; Subject 3 (ST) presented at 14 years for alopecia aerata, pitted nail dystrophy, and goiter. Symptoms for all patients have not progressed to include other signs of APECED.
medical_history.past_medical_history: AR has a history of recurrent infections and candidiasis; DR had hypocalcemia, prolonged Q-T interval, minor facial dysmorphisms, and mild mental retardation; ST had alopecia aerata and thyroid autoimmunity.
medical_history.family_history: Patient AR's mother was found to carry the R257X mutation without any signs of APECED; Patient DR's mother had no mutations identified. ST's mother also showed a mutation (V484M) without signs of the condition.
